params.message:
Elasticsearch query rule '{{rule.name}}' is active:
- Value: {{context.value}} - Conditions Met: {{context.conditions}} over {{rule.params.timeWindowSize}}{{rule.params.timeWindowUnit}} - Timestamp: {{context.date}} - Link: {{context.link}}

esqlQuery.esql: FROM kibana_sample_data_logs | KEEP bytes, clientip, host, geo.dest | where geo.dest != "GB" | STATS sumbytes = sum(bytes) by clientip, host | WHERE sumbytes > 5000 | SORT sumbytes desc | LIMIT 10

esqlQuery.esql: FROM kibana_sample_data_logs | keep bytes, clientip, host, geo.dest | WHERE geo.dest != "GB" | stats sumbytes = sum(bytes) by clientip, host | WHERE sumbytes > 5000 | sort sumbytes desc | limit 10

alert_id.description: An identifier for the alert. The identifier is generated by the rule and might be any arbitrary string.

field_name.description: The name of the runtime field.
field_name.name: fieldName

format.description: Simplified or legacy format for package inputs

page_size.description: The number of items to return
page_size.name: perPage

saved_object_id.description: An identifier for the saved object.
saved_object_id.name: id

space_id.description: An identifier for the space. If `/s/` and the identifier are omitted from the path, the default space is used.
space_id.name: spaceId

view_id.description: An identifier for the data view.
view_id.name: viewId

with_metrics.description: Return agent metrics, false by default
with_metrics.name: withMetrics

items.description: An action that runs under defined conditions.

alerts_filter.description: Conditions that affect whether the action runs. If you specify multiple conditions, all conditions must be met for the action to run. For example, if an alert occurs within the specified time frame and matches the query, the action runs.

query.description: Defines a query filter that determines whether the action runs.

kql.description: A filter written in Kibana Query Language (KQL).

timeframe.description: Defines a period that limits whether the action runs.

days.description: Defines the days of the week that the action can run, represented as an array of numbers. For example, `1` represents Monday. An empty array is equivalent to specifying all the days of the week.

hours.description: Defines the range of time in a day that the action can run. If the `start` value is `00:00` and the `end` value is `24:00`, actions be generated all day.

end.description: The end of the time frame in 24-hour notation (`hh:mm`).

start.description: The start of the time frame in 24-hour notation (`hh:mm`).

timezone.description: The ISO time zone for the `hours` values. Values such as `UTC` and `UTC+1` also work but lack built-in daylight savings time support and are not recommended.

connector_type_id.description: The type of connector. This property appears in responses but cannot be set in requests.

frequency.description: The properties that affect how often actions are generated. If the rule type supports setting `summary` to `true`, the action can be a summary of alerts at the specified notification interval. Otherwise, an action runs for each alert at the specified notification interval. NOTE: You cannot specify these parameters when `notify_when` or `throttle` are defined at the rule level.

summary.description: Indicates whether the action is a summary.

group.description: The group name, which affects when the action runs (for example, when the threshold is met or when the alert is recovered). Each rule type has a list of valid action group names. If you don't need to group actions, set to `default`.

id.description: The identifier for the connector saved object.

params.description: The parameters for the action, which are sent to the connector. The `params` are handled as Mustache templates and passed a default set of context.

uuid.description: A universally unique identifier (UUID) for the action.

cpu_avg.description: Average agent CPU usage during the last 5 minutes, number between 0-1

memory_size_byte_avg.description: Average agent memory consumption during the last 5 minutes

advanced_settings.description: Advanced settings stored in the agent policy, e.g. agent_limits_go_max_procs

items.description: User defined data tags that are added to all of the inputs. The values can be strings or numbers.

is_protected.description: Indicates whether the agent policy has tamper protection enabled. Default false.

keep_monitoring_alive.description: When set to true, monitoring will be enabled but logs/metrics collection will be disabled

overrides.description: Override settings that are defined in the agent policy. Input settings cannot be overridden. The override option should be used only in unusual circumstances and not as a routine procedure.

package_policies.description: This field is present only when retrieving a single agent policy, or when retrieving a list of agent policies with the ?full=true parameter

supports_agentless.description: Indicates whether the agent policy supports agentless integrations. Only allowed in a serverless environment.

force.description: Force agent policy creation even if packages are not verified.

items.description: User defined data tags that are added to all of the inputs. The values can be strings or numbers.

force.description: Force agent policy creation even if packages are not verified.

aggfield.description: The name of the numeric field that is used in the aggregation. This property is required when `aggType` is `avg`, `max`, `min` or `sum`.

aggtype.description: The type of aggregation to perform.

alert_delay.description: Indicates that an alert occurs only when the specified number of consecutive runs met the rule conditions.

active.description: The number of consecutive runs that must meet the rule conditions.

createdAt.description: The date and time that the alert was created.

createdBy.description: The identifier for the user that created the alert.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the alert is currently enabled.

updatedBy.description: The identifier for the user that updated this alert most recently.

allownoindex.description: Allows the data view saved object to exist before the data is available.

attributes.description: The data that you want to create. WARNING: When you create saved objects, attributes are not validated, which allows you to pass arbitrary and ill-formed data into the API that can break Kibana. Make sure any data that you send to the API is properly formed.

budgeting_method.description: The budgeting method to use when computing the rollup data.
budgeting_method.title: Budgeting method

oneOf.description: KQL query string, leave empty to action all agents

force.description: Force upgrade, skipping validation (should be used with caution)

rollout_duration_seconds.description: rolling upgrade window duration in seconds

skipRateLimitCheck.description: Skip rate limit check for upgrade

start_time.description: start time of upgrade in ISO 8601 format

consumer.description: The name of the application or feature that owns the rule. For example: `alerts`, `apm`, `discover`, `infrastructure`, `logs`, `metrics`, `ml`, `monitoring`, `securitySolution`, `siem`, `stackAlerts`, or `uptime`.

core_status_redactedResponse.description: A minimal representation of Kibana's operational status.

level.description: Service status levels as human and machine readable values.

core_status_response.description: Kibana's operational status as well as a detailed breakdown of plugin statuses indication of various loads (like event loop utilization and network traffic) at time of request.

collection_interval_in_millis.description: The interval at which metrics should be collected.

elasticsearch_client.description: Current network metrics of Kibana's Elasticsearch client.

totalActiveSockets.description: Count of network sockets currently in use.

totalIdleSockets.description: Count of network sockets currently idle.

totalQueuedRequests.description: Count of requests not yet assigned to sockets.

detail.description: Human readable detail of the service status.

documentationUrl.description: A URL to further documentation regarding this service.

level.description: Service status levels as human and machine readable values.

meta.description: An unstructured set of extra metadata about this service.

summary.description: A human readable summary of the service status.

detail.description: Human readable detail of the service status.

documentationUrl.description: A URL to further documentation regarding this service.

level.description: Service status levels as human and machine readable values.

meta.description: An unstructured set of extra metadata about this service.

summary.description: A human readable summary of the service status.

detail.description: Human readable detail of the service status.

documentationUrl.description: A URL to further documentation regarding this service.

level.description: Service status levels as human and machine readable values.

meta.description: An unstructured set of extra metadata about this service.

summary.description: A human readable summary of the service status.

detail.description: Human readable detail of the service status.

documentationUrl.description: A URL to further documentation regarding this service.

level.description: Service status levels as human and machine readable values.

meta.description: An unstructured set of extra metadata about this service.

summary.description: A human readable summary of the service status.

plugins.description: A dynamic mapping of plugin ID to plugin status.

uuid.description: Unique, generated Kibana instance UUID. This UUID should persist even if the Kibana process restarts.

build_date.description: The date and time of this build.

build_flavor.description: The build flavour determines configuration and behavior of Kibana. On premise users will almost always run the "traditional" flavour, while other flavours are reserved for Elastic-specific use cases.

build_hash.description: A unique hash value representing the git commit of this Kibana build.

build_number.description: A monotonically increasing number, each subsequent build will have a higher number.

build_snapshot.description: Whether this build is a snapshot build.

create_slo_burn_rate_rule_request.description: A rule that detects when the burn rate is above a defined threshold for two different lookback periods. The two periods are a long period and a short period that is 1/12th of the long period. For each lookback period, the burn rate is computed as the error rate divided by the error budget. When the burn rates for both periods surpass the threshold, an alert occurs.

rule_type_id.description: The ID of the rule type that you want to call when the rule is scheduled to run.

create_slo_burn_rate_rule_request.title: Create slo burn rate rule request

id.description: A optional and unique identifier for the SLO. Must be between 8 and 36 chars

proxy_id.description: The ID of the proxy to use for this download source. See the proxies API for more information.

enabled_rule.description: Indicates whether you want to run the rule on an interval basis after it is created.

consumed.description: The error budget consummed, as a percentage of the initial value.

initial.description: The initial error budget, as 1 - objective

isEstimated.description: Only for SLO defined with occurrences budgeting method and calendar aligned time window.

remaining.description: The error budget remaining, as a percentage of the initial value.

excludehitsfrompreviousrun.description: Indicates whether to exclude matches from previous runs. If `true`, you can avoid alert duplication by excluding documents that have already been detected by the previous rule run. This option is not available when a grouping field is specified.

fieldattrs.description: A map of field attributes by field name.

fieldformats.description: A map of field formats by field name.

array.description: Indicates whether the field is an array.

dynamic.description: Indicates whether it is a dynamic field mapping.

format.description: Indicates the format of the field. For example, if the `type` is `date_range`, the `format` can be `epoch_millis||strict_date_optional_time`.

ignore_above.description: Specifies the maximum length of a string field. Longer strings are not indexed or stored.

index.description: Indicates whether field values are indexed.

type.description: The data type for each object property.

properties.description: Details about the object properties. This property is applicable when `type` is `object`.

required.description: Indicates whether the field is required.

scaling_factor.description: The scaling factor to use when encoding values. This property is applicable when `type` is `scaled_float`. Values will be multiplied by this factor at index time and rounded to the closest long value.

type.description: Specifies the data type for the field.

groupby.description: Indicates whether the aggregation is applied over all documents (`all`) or split into groups (`top`) using a grouping field (`termField`). If grouping is used, an alert will be created for each group when it exceeds the threshold; only the top groups (up to `termSize` number of groups) are checked.

initial_namespaces.description: Identifiers for the spaces in which this object is created. If this is provided, the object is created only in the explicitly defined spaces. If this is not provided, the object is created in the current space (default behavior). For shareable object types (registered with `namespaceType: 'multiple'`), this option can be used to specify one or more spaces, including the "All spaces" identifier ('*'). For isolated object types (registered with `namespaceType: 'single'` or `namespaceType: 'multiple-isolated'`), this option can only be used to specify a single space, and the "All spaces" identifier ('*') is not allowed. For global object types (`registered with `namespaceType: agnostic`), this option cannot be used.

latest_executed_state.description: Latest successfully executed state in package install state machine

oneOf.description: the KQL query to filter the documents with.

kql_with_filters_good.description: The KQL query used to define the good events.

oneOf.description: the KQL query to filter the documents with.

kql_with_filters_total.description: The KQL query used to define all events.

oneOf.description: the KQL query to filter the documents with.

kql_with_filters_total.title: KQL query for all events

name_rule.description: The name of the rule. While this name does not have to be unique, a distinctive name can help you identify a rule.

namespaces.description: An array of space identifiers for sharing the data view between multiple spaces.

notify_when.description: Deprecated in 8.13.0. Use the `notify_when` property in the action `frequency` object instead. Indicates how often alerts generate actions. NOTE: You cannot specify `notify_when` at both the rule and action level. If you set it at the rule level then update the rule in Kibana, it is automatically changed to use action-specific values.

notify_when_action.description: Indicates how often alerts generate actions. Valid values include: `onActionGroupChange`: Actions run when the alert status changes; `onActiveAlert`: Actions run when the alert becomes active and at each check interval while the rule conditions are met; `onThrottleInterval`: Actions run when the alert becomes active and at the interval specified in the throttle property while the rule conditions are met. NOTE: You cannot specify `notify_when` at both the rule and action level. The recommended method is to set it for each action. If you set it at the rule level then update the rule in Kibana, it is automatically changed to use action-specific values.

objective.description: Defines properties for the SLO objective

target.description: the target objective between 0 and 1 excluded

timesliceTarget.description: the target objective for each slice when using a timeslices budgeting method

timesliceWindow.description: the duration of each slice when using a timeslices budgeting method, as {duraton}{unit}

objective.title: Objective

when.description: Deprecated, kafka output do not support conditionnal topics anymore.
Deprecated, kafka output do not support conditionnal topics anymore.

release.description: release label is deprecated, derive from the version instead (packages follow semver)

force.description: Force package policy creation even if package is not verified, or if the agent policy is managed.

inputs.description: Package policy inputs (see integration documentation to know what inputs are available)

namespace.description: The package policy namespace. Leave blank to inherit the agent policy's namespace.

overrides.description: Override settings that are defined in the package policy. The override option should be used only in unusual circumstances and not as a routine procedure.

policy_id.description: Agent policy ID where that package policy will be added

policy_ids.description: Agent policy IDs where that package policy will be added

vars.description: Package root level variable (see integration documentation for more information)

enabled.description: enable or disable that input, (default to true)

streams.description: Input streams (see integration documentation to know what streams are available)

vars.description: Input level variable (see integration documentation for more information)

enabled.description: enable or disable that stream, (default to true)

vars.description: Stream level variable (see integration documentation for more information)

oneOf.description: The parameters for an Elasticsearch query rule that uses ES|QL to define the query. This functionality is in technical pre view and may be changed or removed in a future release. Elastic will work to fix any issues, but features in technical preview are not subject to the support SLA of official GA features.

esql.description: The query definition, which uses Elasticsearch Query Language.

searchType.description: The type of query, in this case a query that uses Elasticsearch Query Language (ES|QL).

size.description: When `searchType` is `esqlQuery`, this property is required but it does not affect the rule behavior.

threshold.description: The threshold value that is used with the `thresholdComparator`. When `searchType` is `esqlQuery`, this property is required and must be set to zero.

thresholdComparator.description: The comparison function for the threshold. When `searchType` is `esqlQuery`, this property is required and must be set to ">". Since the `threshold` value must be `0`, the result is that an alert occurs whenever the query returns results.

oneOf.description: The parameters for an Elasticsearch query rule that uses KQL or Lucene to define the query.

searchConfiguration.description: The query definition, which uses KQL or Lucene to fetch the documents from Elasticsearch.

searchType.description: The type of query, in this case a text-based query that uses KQL or Lucene.

oneOf.description: The parameters for an Elasticsearch query rule that uses Elasticsearch Query DSL to define the query.

esQuery.description: The query definition, which uses Elasticsearch Query DSL.

searchType.description: The type of query, in this case a query that uses Elasticsearch Query DSL.

params_index_threshold_rule.description: The parameters for an index threshold rule.

filterKuery.description: A KQL expression thats limits the scope of alerts.

burnRateThreshold.description: The burn rate threshold used to trigger the alert

longWindow.description: The duration of the long window used to compute the burn rate

maxBurnRateThreshold.description: The maximum burn rate threshold value defined by the SLO error budget

shortWindow.description: The duration of the short window used to compute the burn rate

sloId.description: The SLO identifier used by the rule

references.description: Objects with `name`, `id`, and `type` properties that describe the other saved objects that this object references. Use `name` in attributes to refer to the other saved object, but never the `id`, which can update automatically during migrations or import and export.

api_key_created_by_user.description: Indicates whether the API key that is associated with the rule was created by the user.

api_key_owner.description: The owner of the API key that is associated with the rule and used to run background tasks.

consumer.description: The application or feature that owns the rule. For example, `alerts`, `apm`, `discover`, `infrastructure`, `logs`, `metrics`, `ml`, `monitoring`, `securitySolution`, `siem`, `stackAlerts`, or `uptime`.

created_at.description: The date and time that the rule was created.

created_by.description: The identifier for the user that created the rule.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the rule is currently enabled.

notify_when.description: Indicates how often alerts generate actions.

params.description: The parameters for the rule.

rule_type_id.description: The identifier for the type of rule. For example, `.es-query`, `.index-threshold`, `logs.alert.document.count`, `monitoring_alert_cluster_health`, `siem.thresholdRule`, or `xpack.ml.anomaly_detection_alert`.

running.description: Indicates whether the rule is running.

updated_at.description: The date and time that the rule was updated most recently.

updated_by.description: The identifier for the user that updated this rule most recently.

runtimefieldmap.description: A map of runtime field definitions by field name.

type.description: Mapping type of the runtime field.

schedule.description: The check interval, which specifies how frequently the rule conditions are checked. The interval is specified in seconds, minutes, hours, or days.

frequency.description: Configure how often the transform runs, default 1m

preventInitialBackfill.description: Prevents the transform from backfilling data when it starts.

syncDelay.description: The synch delay to apply to the transform. Default 1m

size.description: The number of documents to pass to the configured actions when the threshold condition is met.

enabled.description: Indicate if the SLO is enabled

groupBy.description: optional group by field to use to generate an SLO per distinct value

enabled.description: Indicate if the SLO is enabled

groupBy.description: optional group by field to use to generate an SLO per distinct value

instanceId.description: the value derived from the groupBy field, if present, otherwise '*'

sourcefilters.description: The array of field names you want to filter out in Discover.

delete.description: Deletes referenced saved object if all references are removed.

forId.description: Limit the affected saved objects to one or more by identifier.

forType.description: Limit the affected saved objects by type.

fromId.description: The saved object reference to change.

fromType.description: Specify the type of the saved object reference to alter. The default value is `index-pattern` for data views.

toId.description: New saved object reference value to replace the old value.

termfield.description: The names of up to four fields that are used for grouping the aggregation. This property is required when `groupBy` is `top`.

termsize.description: This property is required when `groupBy` is `top`. It specifies the number of groups to check against the threshold and therefore limits the number of alerts on high cardinality fields.

threshold.description: The threshold value that is used with the `thresholdComparator`. If the `thresholdComparator` is `between` or `notBetween`, you must specify the boundary values.

thresholdcomparator.description: The comparison function for the threshold. For example, "is above", "is above or equals", "is below", "is below or equals", "is between", and "is not between".

throttle.description: Deprecated in 8.13.0. Use the `throttle` property in the action `frequency` object instead. The throttle interval, which defines how often an alert generates repeated actions. NOTE: You cannot specify the throttle interval at both the rule and action level. If you set it at the rule level then update the rule in Kibana, it is automatically changed to use action-specific values.

throttle_action.description: The throttle interval, which defines how often an alert generates repeated actions. It is specified in seconds, minutes, hours, or days and is applicable only if `notify_when` is set to `onThrottleInterval`. NOTE: You cannot specify the throttle interval at both the rule and action level. The recommended method is to set it for each action. If you set it at the rule level then update the rule in Kibana, it is automatically changed to use action-specific values.

time_window.description: Defines properties for the SLO time window

duration.description: the duration formatted as {duration}{unit}. Accepted values for rolling: 7d, 30d, 90d. Accepted values for calendar aligned: 1w (weekly) or 1M (monthly)

type.description: Indicates weither the time window is a rolling or a calendar aligned time window.

time_window.title: Time window

timefield.description: The field that is used to calculate the time window.

timefieldname.description: The timestamp field name, which you use for time-based data views.

aggregation.description: The aggregation type of the metric.

filter.description: The filter to apply to the metric.

name.description: The name of the metric. Only valid options are A-Z

timeslice_metric_basic_metric_with_field.title: Timeslice Metric Basic Metric with Field

aggregation.description: The aggregation type of the metric. Only valid option is "doc_count"

filter.description: The filter to apply to the metric.

name.description: The name of the metric. Only valid options are A-Z

aggregation.description: The aggregation type of the metric. Only valid option is "percentile"

filter.description: The filter to apply to the metric.

name.description: The name of the metric. Only valid options are A-Z

timewindowsize.description: The size of the time window (in `timeWindowUnit` units), which determines how far back to search for documents. Generally it should be a value higher than the rule check interval to avoid gaps in detection.

timewindowunit.description: The type of units for the time window: seconds, minutes, hours, or days.

title.description: Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases that you want to search. Supports wildcards (`*`).

type.description: When set to `rollup`, identifies the rollup data views.

typemeta.description: When you use rollup indices, contains the field list for the rollup data view API endpoints.

aggs.description: A map of rollup restrictions by aggregation type and field name.

params.description: Properties for retrieving rollup fields.

typemeta_response.description: When you use rollup indices, contains the field list for the rollup data view API endpoints.

aggs.description: A map of rollup restrictions by aggregation type and field name.

params.description: Properties for retrieving rollup fields.

data_view.description: The data view properties you want to update. Only the specified properties are updated in the data view. Unspecified fields stay as they are persisted.

refresh_fields.description: Reloads the data view fields after the data view is updated.

update_rule_request.description: The update rule API request body varies depending on the type of rule and actions.

params.description: The parameters for the rule.

update_rule_request.title: Update rule request

update_slo_request.description: The update SLO API request body varies depending on the type of indicator, time window and budgeting method. Partial update is handled.
update_slo_request.title: Update SLO request

force.description: Force upgrade, skipping validation (should be used with caution)

skipRateLimitCheck.description: Skip rate limit check for upgrade

parameters.description: When set to true, retrieve the related package policies for each agent policy.
parameters.name: full

parameters.description: When set to true, do not count how many agents are in the agent policy, this can improve performance if you are searching over a large number of agent policies. The "agents" property will always be 0 if set to true.
parameters.name: noAgentCount

force.description: bypass validation checks that can prevent agent policy deletion

post.description: To create a rule, you must have `all` privileges for the appropriate Kibana features, depending on the `consumer` and `rule_type_id` of the rule you're creating. For example, you must have privileges for the **Management > Stack rules** feature, **Analytics > Discover** and **Machine Learning** features, **Observability** features, or **Security** features. If the rule has actions, you must also have `read` privileges for the **Management > Actions and Connectors** feature. This API supports both key- and token-based authentication. To use key-based authentication, create an API key in Kibana and use it in the header of the API call. To use token-based authentication, provide a username and password; an API key that matches the current privileges of the user is created automatically. In both cases, the API key is subsequently used for authorization when the rule runs.

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

post.summary: Create a rule with a random identifier

get.description: You must have `read` privileges for the appropriate Kibana features, depending on the `consumer` and `rule_type_id` of the rules you're seeking. For example, the **Management > Stack Rules** feature, **Analytics > Discover** and **Machine Learning** features, **Observability** features, or **Security** features. To get rules associated with the **Stack Monitoring** feature, use the `monitoring_user` built-in role.

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

post.description: This API creates a rule with a specific rule identifier. If you omit the identifer, it is automatically generated. To create a rule, you must have `all` privileges for the appropriate Kibana features, depending on the `consumer` and `rule_type_id` of the rule you're creating. For example, you must have privileges for the **Management > Stack rules** feature, **Analytics > Discover** and **Machine Learning** features, **Observability** features, or **Security** features. If the rule has actions, you must also have `read` privileges for the **Management > Actions and Connectors** feature. This API supports both key- and token-based authentication. To use key-based authentication, create an API key in Kibana and use it in the header of the API call. To use token-based authentication, provide a username and password; an API key that matches the current privileges of the user is created automatically. In both cases, the API key is subsequently used for authorization when the rule runs.

parameters.description: An UUID v1 or v4 identifier for the rule. If you omit this parameter, an identifier is randomly generated.
parameters.name: ruleId

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

put.description: To update a rule, you must have `all` privileges for the appropriate Kibana features, depending on the `consumer` and `rule_type_id` of the rule you're updating. For example, you must have privileges for the **Management > Stack rules** feature, **Analytics > Discover** and **Machine Learning** features, **Observability** features, or **Security** features. If the rule has actions, you must also have `read` privileges for the **Management > Actions and Connectors** feature. This API supports both key- and token-based authentication. To use key-based authentication, create an API key in Kibana and use it in the header of the API call. To use token-based authentication, provide a username and password; an API key that matches the current privileges of the user is created automatically. In both cases, the API key is subsequently used for authorization when the rule runs. NOTE: If the API key has different privileges than the key that created or most recently updated the rule, the rule behavior might change. Though some properties are optional, when you update the rule the existing property values are overwritten with default values. Therefore, it is recommended to explicitly set all property values.

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

delete.description: To delete a rule, you must have `all` privileges for the appropriate Kibana features, depending on the `consumer` and `rule_type_id` of the rule you're deleting. For example, the **Management** > **Stack Rules** feature, **Analytics** > **Discover** or **Machine Learning** features, **Observability**, or **Security** features. WARNING: After you delete a rule, you cannot recover it. If the API key that is used by the rule was created automatically, it is deleted.

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

get.description: You must have `read` privileges for the appropriate Kibana features, depending on the `consumer` and `rule_type_id` of the rules you're seeking. For example, you must have privileges for the **Management > Stack rules** feature, **Analytics > Discover** and **Machine Learning** features, **Observability** features, or **Security** features. To find rules associated with the **Stack Monitoring** feature, use the `monitoring_user` built-in role.

parameters.description: The default operator to use for the simple_query_string.
parameters.name: default_search_operator

parameters.description: The fields to return in the `attributes` key of the response.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: A KQL string that you filter with an attribute from your saved object. It should look like `savedObjectType.attributes.title: "myTitle"`. However, if you used a direct attribute of a saved object, such as `updatedAt`, you must define your filter, for example, `savedObjectType.updatedAt > 2018-12-22`.
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: Filters the rules that have a relation with the reference objects with a specific type and identifier.
parameters.name: has_reference

parameters.description: The page number to return.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The number of rules to return per page.
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: An Elasticsearch simple_query_string query that filters the objects in the response.
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: The fields to perform the simple_query_string parsed query against.
parameters.name: search_fields

parameters.description: Determines which field is used to sort the results. The field must exist in the `attributes` key of the response.
parameters.name: sort_field

parameters.description: Determines the sort order.
parameters.name: sort_order

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

delete.description: WARNING: When you delete a data view, it cannot be recovered.

post.description:
Create sets of Kibana saved objects from a file created by the export API.
Saved objects can be imported only into the same version, a newer minor on the same major, or the next major. Exported saved objects are not backwards compatible and cannot be imported into an older version of Kibana.

This functionality is in technical preview and may be changed or removed in a future release. Elastic will work to fix any issues, but features in technical preview are not subject to the support SLA of official GA features.

parameters.description: Creates copies of saved objects, regenerates each object ID, and resets the origin. When used, potential conflict errors are avoided. NOTE: This option cannot be used with the `overwrite` and `compatibilityMode` options.
parameters.name: createNewCopies

parameters.description: Overwrites saved objects when they already exist. When used, potential conflict errors are automatically resolved by overwriting the destination object. NOTE: This option cannot be used with the `createNewCopies` option.
parameters.name: overwrite

parameters.description: Applies various adjustments to the saved objects that are being imported to maintain compatibility between different Kibana versions. Use this option only if you encounter issues with imported saved objects. NOTE: This option cannot be used with the `createNewCopies` option.
parameters.name: compatibilityMode

file.description: A file exported using the export API. NOTE: The `savedObjects.maxImportExportSize` configuration setting limits the number of saved objects which may be included in this file. Similarly, the `savedObjects.maxImportPayloadBytes` setting limits the overall size of the file that can be imported.

errors.description:
Indicates the import was unsuccessful and specifies the objects that failed to import.

NOTE: One object may result in multiple errors, which requires separate steps to resolve. For instance, a `missing_references` error and conflict error.

success.description: Indicates when the import was successfully completed. When set to false, some objects may not have been created. For additional information, refer to the `errors` and `successResults` properties.

successCount.description: Indicates the number of successfully imported records.

successResults.description:
Indicates the objects that are successfully imported, with any metadata if applicable.

NOTE: Objects are created only when all resolvable errors are addressed, including conflicts and missing references. If objects are created as new copies, each entry in the `successResults` array includes a `destinationId` attribute.

parameters.description: Whether to exclude the install status of each package. Enabling this option will opt in to caching for the response via `cache-control` headers. If you don't need up-to-date installation info for a package, and are querying for a list of available packages, providing this flag can improve performance substantially.
parameters.name: excludeInstallStatus

parameters.description: Whether to return prerelease versions of packages (e.g. beta, rc, preview)
parameters.name: prerelease

parameters.description: avoid erroring out on unexpected mapping update errors
parameters.name: ignoreMappingUpdateErrors

parameters.description: Skip data stream rollover during index template mapping or settings update
parameters.name: skipDataStreamRollover

post.summary: Install by package by direct upload

parameters.description: Ignore if the package is fails signature verification
parameters.name: ignoreUnverified

parameters.description: Return all fields from the package manifest, not just those supported by the Elastic Package Registry
parameters.name: full

parameters.description: Whether to return prerelease versions of packages (e.g. beta, rc, preview)
parameters.name: prerelease

parameters.description: avoid erroring out on unexpected mapping update errors
parameters.name: ignoreMappingUpdateErrors

parameters.description: Skip data stream rollover during index template mapping or settings update
parameters.name: skipDataStreamRollover

parameters.description: delete package even if policies used by agents
parameters.name: force
